intro: Cordylanthus kingii var. densiflorus, commonly known as the denseflower woollypod, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
